newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Carpenter has A$23 mln from options issue.
newsitem.headline: Carpenter has A$23 mln from options issue.

text.p: Carpenter Pacific Resources NL, a partner in Papua New Guinea's Mt Kare gold project, said on Thursday that it had raised A$23.03 million from an options issue.

The company said it had been guaranteed to raise A$10 million from the issue of 40 million June 30, 1997, options at 25 cents each through an underwriting deal with Prudential Bache, Paul Morgan Securities and ABS White and Co.
It did not say what the funds would be used for.

Carpenter's Matu Mining unit the licence contract at Mt Kare, which the company has said could be similar in size to the nearby PNG Highlands mine called Porgera which produces up to one million ounces of gold each year.
Carpenter shares were 1.5 cents higher at 25 cents at 2.45 p.m. (0445 GMT).
